Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

We have a robust approach to ethical fashion â€“ for over 20 years our Global Souring Principles have been key to how we work with our suppliers and we have zero tolerance for forced labour. We do not work with any supplier in or source from the Xinjiang region. (1/3)

Additionally, as part of our audit process we identify the demographics of all workers in our manufacturing sites and as due diligence we have also been conducting additional assessments with our suppliers to identify if there is any employment of Uyghur people. (2/3)

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

We have a robust approach to ethical fashion â€“ for over 20 years our Global Souring Principles have been key to how we work with our suppliers and we have zero tolerance for forced labour. We do not work with any supplier in or source from the Xinjiang region. (1/3)

Additionally, as part of our audit process we identify the demographics of all workers in our manufacturing sites and as due diligence we have also been conducting additional assessments with our suppliers to identify if there is any employment of Uyghur people.(2/3)

This is an issue for the sector and we remain committed to working collaboratively with industry organisations and other retailers, as well as continuing with our robust independent audits across every region we work in. (3/3)

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

The responsibility for wearing a face-covering falls to the individual, and we'll not be asking anyone working in store to enforce the wearing of a face covering by customers. We would suggest that anyone who is manning the queuing system to remind customers (unless they are..

obviously exempt) that they should be wearing a face covering when they enter the store to encourage them to do this and to explain the law on this. However, if a customer refuses to wear a face covering, then our colleagues will not bar entry or refuse to..

serve them as there are a number of reasons why someone might not be wearing a covering eg physical or mental illness, distress from wearing a face mask or to avoid harm or injury, or the risk of harm or injury, to yourself or others. I hope this helps

obviously exempt) that they should be wearing a face covering when they enter the store to encourage them to do this and to explain the law on this. However, if a customer refuses to wear a face covering, then our colleagues will not bar entry or refuse to..

serve them as there are a number of reasons why someone might not be wearing a covering eg physical or mental illness, distress from wearing a face mask or to avoid harm or injury, or the risk of harm or injury, to yourself or others. I hope this helps

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3

Hi, thanks for your feedback. The issue of plastic is really important to us and our priority is to remove it from our packaging. Our goal is to remove all hard to recycle plastics from our products and ensure all our packaging is widely recycled by 2022. 1/3

To this end, weâ€™ve removed 1,000 tonnes of single-use plastic packaging from our business and have plans to remove a further 1,000 tonnes by March 2020. We've already removed 2,700 tonnes of black plastic (such as our Mini Bites tubs, meat, fish and poultry and fruit... 2/3

...and veg) and have recently started replacing our black ready meal trays with widely recyclable alternatives. We will be completely out of black plastic by the end of 2020. Weâ€™re also rolling out a take-back scheme for any plastics that are hard to recycle in the home. 3/3
